title: Past Simple, Past Continuous or Past Perfect
instructions: Complete the sentences with the verbs. Use B1past simpleB2, B1past continuousB2 or B1past peferctB2.

remarks: Corr: arrived. It's past simple, nothing interrupted this action and it didn't happen before anything.
Corr: had drunk. It's past perfect because it had happened before the speaker arrived home. It can't be continuous because of 'all the drinks', so it is a finished action.
Corr: had eaten. It's past perfect because it had happened before the speaker arrived home. It can't be continuous because of 'all the food', so it is a finished action.
Corr: were dansing. This action was in progress when the speaker arrived home.
